info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 21 at 2:00PM EDT by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of western Bradford County through 245 PM EDT... At 200 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Lawrenceville to near Buttonwood to near R.B. Winter State Park. Movement was northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Grover around 225 PM EDT. Canton around 230 PM EDT. Sylvania around 240 PM EDT. Troy and Springfield around 245 PM EDT. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
